intro: Crotalaria tenuiflora, commonly known as slenderflower cowpea, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers with a distinctive spurred structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Due to its ornamental value and potential as a forage crop, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and agricultural purposes.
